title._content: [Portrait of Vernon Friley, Irv Dinkin, Jim Harwood, John Chance, Paul Kashian, Nick Travis, Chuck Genduso, and Joe Ferrante, Hotel Commodore, Century Room, New York, N.Y., ca. Jan. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Vernon Friley, Irv Dinkin, Jim Harwood, John Chance, Paul Kashian, Nick Travis, Chuck Genduso, and Joe Ferrante, Hotel Commodore, Century Room, New York, N.Y., ca. Jan. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: (center) trombone section, (left to right) Vernon Friley, Irv Dinkin, Jim Harwood; Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 219 Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "McKinley ork plays most interesting dance music in biz," Down Beat, v. 16, no. 3 (Jan. 29, 1947), p. 8. Subjects: Friley, Vernon, 1924- Dinkin, Irv Harwood, Jim Chance, John Kashian, Paul Travis, Nick Genduso, Chuck Ferrante, Joe, 1929-1980 Ray McKinley Orchestra Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Big bands--1940-1950. Trombonists--1940-1950. Hotel Commodore Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.13781 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 1378
